title: Shannon Noll is back with a new single he calls the 'theme song for the summer'
text:
Shannon Noll has revealed that he is back with a new single.

The 44-year-old took to Instagram on Saturday to announce his new tune, Long Live the Summer.

In a short video posted to the social media site, Nollsie revealed that the single is now available for pre-order.

What about him! Shannon Noll (pictured) revealed on Saturday that he is back with a new single he calls the 'theme song for the summer'

He said the news was 'exciting' and urged his fans to buy his latest track, Long Live the Summer.

Shannon captioned the video clip: 'Hey guys, I got some very exciting news! You can pre-order my new single 'Long Live The Summer' today, hope you like it guys.

He added very excitedly: 'Theme song for the summer!'

Coming soon! The 44-year-old took to Instagram on Saturday to make the announcement and tell fans there is new music on the way

Shannon captioned the video clip: 'Hey guys, I got some very exciting news! You can pre-order my new single 'Long Live The Summer' today, hope you like it guys'

The singer has signed a new record deal with independent label Social Family Records (SFR).

He was previously signed with Warner Music Australia, releasing his third album, Unbroken, through the label in 2018.

Shannon rose to fame when he became the runner-up on the first season of Australian Idol in 2003.

He was signed to Sony BMG at the time and released his multi-Platinum hit, a cover of the song What About Me, in 2004.

The iconic singer found himself in hot water in 2017 when he became involved in a brawl with security guards outside the Crazy Horse adult club in Adelaide.

In January 2018, he appeared on the fourth season of of I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here!
